DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Specimen Inadequate For WES Shipping Due To Normal DNA Extraction Tumor Tissue Normal Mismatch Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator response regarding a tumor specimen that did not meet requirements for shipping for the purpose of whole exome sequencing due to mismatch with tumor/normal.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Specimen Inadequate For WES Shipping Due To Normal DNA Extraction Tumor Tissue Normal Mismatch
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement._The reason of something._A failure to correspond or match; to match unsuitably or inaccurately._A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for all of the exons in an individual._The act or business of transporting goods._Caused by or resulting from._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Inadequate For Whole Exome Sequencing Shipping Due To Normal DNA Extraction Tumor Tissue Normal Mismatch
Property.preferredDefinition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.:The reason of something.:A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for all of the exons in an individual.:The act or business of transporting goods.:Caused by or resulting from.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.:The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.:A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:A failure to correspond or match; to match unsuitably or inaccurately.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for all of the exons in an individual.
The act or business of transporting goods.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
A failure to correspond or match; to match unsuitably or inaccurately.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
